{"step_by_step_thinking": "Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) is a group of rare disorders caused by mutations in different genes involved in the development and function of infection-fighting immune cells. ARTEMIS gene is one of the genes that, when mutated, can cause a form of SCID. Therefore, the mutation of the ARTEMIS gene can indeed cause severe combined immunodeficiency.", "answer_choice": "A"}
